description: From Middle English harmful, from Old English *hearmful (suggested by hearmfullīċ (“harmful; hurtful”)), equivalent to harm +‎ -ful.
Cognate with German harmvoll, Danish harmfuld, Swedish harmfull.

adjectives.description: harmful (comparative harmfuller or more harmful, superlative harmfullest or most harmful)

entries.meaning: of a kind likely to be damaging; injurious
examples: Wear a hat to protect your skin from harmful sunlight.
